711542f-a.text:
320 East 20th Street, south side between First and Second Avenue showing P.S.#40.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.
Credit Line Imperative.    1920.

707529f-a.text:
First Avenue (across view from right to left, obscured by rooftops on the westerly side), from E. 20 St. (extreme right) to E. 23rd (extreme left) Streets, as viewed eastward from a loft structure at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue and E. 22nd Street. This area is better known as the "Gas House" because of tanks and plants of the Consolidated Edison Go. and  produced many a Tammany Hall politician. Most of this area was formerly under water and subsequent landfills for the new East River Drive will extend the line further. Across the East River appears the Greenpoint
section of Brooklyn.
Septemher 2, 1929,
Views 1,2 and 3
~.L. Sperr
